nodes.bodyText: No need to clean up here. The nightly jobs will clean these identities up
All of these configurations are lifted from the now defunct jvm pom.xml so that the jvm tests still run with the same settings
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -117,6 +117,29 @@
                     <argLine>
                         -javaagent:${settings.localRepository}/org/jmockit/jmockit/1.24/jmockit-1.24.jar
                     </argLine>
+
+                    <includes>
+                        <!-- Mvn install will run tests found in the files that match the ______Tests.java naming pattern -->
+                        <include>*Tests.java</include>
+                    </includes>
+
+                    <!--
+                    For more details on parallelization in use here, see:
+                    http://maven.apache.org/surefire/maven-surefire-plugin/examples/fork-options-and-parallel-execution.html
+                    -->
+                    <!--Intentionally not using multiple forks. Tests are safe across threads, but don't appear to be safe across jvm instances at the same time-->
+                    <forkCount>1</forkCount>
+
+                    <!--Tests can be run in parallel with tests within their own test class as well as in parallel with tests from other test classes-->
+                    <parallel>both</parallel>
+
+                    <!--Maven will spawn up as many threads as it wants/can while running tests in parallel-->
+                    <useUnlimitedThreads>true</useUnlimitedThreads>
+
+                    <skipITs>${skipITs}</skipITs>
+                    <argLine>
+                        -javaagent:${settings.localRepository}/org/jmockit/jmockit/1.24/jmockit-1.24.jar
+                    </argLine>

nodes.bodyText: Now that we don't have separate runners for tpm/symmetrickey/x509, there is no way to just tag the TPM tests as flakey since it is in the same class as symmetric key and x509

nodes.bodyText: This "skipITs" flag has outlived its usefulness, so I'm killing it. There are maven sponsored ways to skip integration tests
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -38,7 +38,6 @@
 
     <properties>
         <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
-        <skipITs>true</skipITs>

nodes.bodyText: Very orthogonal, but this unit test takes 1 minute to run, and adds nothing valuable

In turning the common module into a test project, this jar no longer contains the actual test code that android needs to run. Switching over to local references because there is no other way to get the "iot-e2e-common-0.26.0-tests.jar" file
In the pom file for the common module, I have excluded these jars from the shade jar, so there is no need to exclude them here anymore
previously, this test code was in a normal jar, not a test jar. This extra step is now necessary to package this new test project
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -100,6 +96,20 @@
                     <compilerArgument>-XDignore.symbol.file</compilerArgument>
                 </configuration>
             </plugin>
+            <plugin>
+                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
+                <artifactId>maven-jar-plugin</artifactId>
+                <version>2.2</version>
+                <executions>
+                    <execution>
+                        <goals>
+                            <!--This plugin will generate a jar file that contains all the test code so that the android
+                            test code can reference it.-->
+                            <goal>test-jar</goal>

nodes.bodyText: These settings are taken directly from the old JVM module
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -113,10 +123,17 @@
                     </execution>
                 </executions>
                 <configuration>
-                    <skipITs>${skipITs}</skipITs>
-                    <argLine>
-                        -javaagent:${settings.localRepository}/org/jmockit/jmockit/1.24/jmockit-1.24.jar
-                    </argLine>
+                    <includes>
+                        <!--By default, only test files that end in ___Test.java are recognized as tests. This statement extends that to ___Tests.java files-->
+                        <include>*Tests.java</include>
+                    </includes>
+                    <forkCount>1</forkCount>
+
+                    <!--Tests can be run in parallel with tests within their own test class as well as in parallel with tests from other test classes-->
+                    <parallel>both</parallel>
+
+                    <!--Maven will spawn up as many threads as it wants/can while running tests in parallel-->
+                    <useUnlimitedThreads>true</useUnlimitedThreads>

nodes.bodyText: This annotation used to sit at the JVMRunner level, but since that level no longer exists, this logic is here
nit: braces n the same line or on new line?
new line, good catch
why do we want tests to fail if teardown fails? Anything that is relevant to the test case should be a part of the test method directly.
Good point. I'll remove this
why ignored?
These tests were previously ignored through the pom file rather than in source. I'm just moving the ignore back into source so it is more obvious that this test isn't being run

azure-iot-sdk-java/iot-e2e-tests/jvm/pom.xml
    
    
         Line 126
      in
      453b31c
    
    
    
    

        
          
           **/JobClientJVMRunner.java
This might be a good time to remove these test re-runs
Sure thing
Do we still need these android runners? Is it for separating tests by test groups?
At this point, yes, they only exist so that we can run them in smaller groups
nit - and not directly related to this PR: these var names should also specify the time unit; is it 60 * 1000 ms/ 60 * 1000 secs/ 60 * 1000 mins ....?
Milliseconds, and sure, I can scrub through these real fast
we should log something here, to indicate that env var retrieval from buildConfig failed.
Our e2e test suite currently doesn't log anything but test failures
I can see about adding this, though
this shouldn't be required any more, correct?
Yep, I'll delete this
